FOUND IN: Haversack (an older term for a soldier's bag or pouch, but still fitting)

The word has its origins in the Middle English 'dirge', which came from the Anglo-French adaptation of the Latin term '*dirae*, meaning "sorrows." In medieval times, dirges often referenced the Lamentations of Jeremiah and were set to a specific chant tune known as the "Dolorsi mode," indicating deep sorrow.
Halloween Costumes (as many pumpkin festivals occur around Halloween time)
Gardaí (official name for members of An Garda Síochána)
Fennel (Herbaceous plant with a similar appearance)
Multiplication table (represents the concept of repeated addition, essential to understanding series and sequences)
